title: What is This font? (Mix of Sans serifs)
content:
I am looking for this font. Please help me. I need this urgent!!!

Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_3439.png)

Font: 

 DIN Neuzeit® Grotesk Bold Condensed 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")
author: rakib-bd

comments.content:
I think more than one font is being used. Which one do you want us to identify?

The numerals look like [Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/neuzeit-grotesk/).

- Mike Yanega

Thank you for your reply. I think all of these letters are of one font. You can take **"Md Shahinul"**.

Neuzeit-grotesk do not work for the alphabets. Look at the letter 'a' and ' l ' ...

I took it from German language.

All the big letters look like Neuzeit Grotesk Bold Condensed or DIN306040 with shadows or not.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mdsha1_6331.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mdsha2_4912.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mdsha3_4175.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mdsha4_4256.jpg)
Thank you DPape. Yes I got it. It is DIN 'Neuzeit® Grotesk Bold Condensed'. :D
